title: Lordsilvabtc
author: Lordsilvabtc
content: Greetings Everyone!The level of crypto valuation this days it's honestly becoming a trending topics, Couple with the fact that Scammer's, Are using project as a tool to rip off investors with the help of influencers, with the way things have paved way in the last few days one needs to be extremely careful how you allowed your self to be manipulated by those so called influencers, It wasn't long ago when Kim was exposed, about promoting a Crypto project without indicating, it was a paid promotion, Nevertheless this can't be label as a scam project yet, but the proposed regulation of the influencers paid advertisment is a hot top, Kim stories can be found here via https://www.npr.org/2022/10/03/1126526883/sec-charges-kim-kardashian-for-unlawfully-touting-crypto-on-her-instagram-accounI read an article, Few days back, A report from ( BBB ) from livebitcoinnews.com on how crypto scam has now become the second deadliest scams, And looking at those Scammer's strategies, they make use of Influencers to attract investors, Which prompt to this question, What's the reason for doing all of this, allowing your followers to be ripped off, Just because you're paid for that. The BBB story can be found here via https://www.livebitcoinnews.com/bbb-crypto-scams-are-now-the-second-deadliest-scams/On today's news it was brought to my notice on Marketwatch about Mazini, A popular influencers, who amassed over 1 million followers on Instagram using crypto and other medium of BlockChain, to steal and scam investors off their hard earn money. For the past few months we've watch videos of him, how he go about doing good, helping the poor, in the process he becomes the talk of the town. he's been mostly loved by Undergraduate and people from the less privilege homes. only to be investigated and found out he's involved in over $8 million scam, from thousands of people through a Ponzi scheme and crypto scam. as things stand he has pleaded guilty to stealing, using Crypto as a tools. this is a bad omen and I expect everyone out there to learn this lesson of being involved, because an Influencers is promoting a promoting a project, or intiatives doesn't makes it Scam free. the news can be found here via https://www.marketwatch.com/story/instagram-influencer-jay-mazini-pleads-guilty-to-running-8-million-ponzi-scheme-and-crypto-scam-11667414900Now my advice to everyone reading this, Do not allowed your self to be massively influences by those influencers you followed on social media, one needs to be extremely careful on how you get involved in those touting project, Influencers don't care about you as long as they get paid for paid promotion, That's why you see a lot of project Scammer's exploring influencers weakness, by capturing the heart of it's followers and ends up on the losing side.Always do your own personal research, Be sure you're satisfied with the information gotten so far by you. not what an influencers said, take it up as a task, to do your own research and come up with your own personal results and strategies to determine if it's a good push to get involved in by yourself, to be sure you're up for what you're doing. This is just my piece of advice to you, Please feel free to contribute, Newbies planning to go into investment please, try as much as possible to avoid be influence and manipulated into investment on a project.

comments.body: Countless number of times, I've advice close pals of mine to be careful about the so call influencers hype of a thing, Everyone is just after their own pockets, that's why you see most of those coins or Crypto Tokens died as fast as possible, as soon as the hype is gone, the token is died, the project disappear, we just have to be careful, learn the tricks and stay on board, investigate, and research to know what's Worth and what's not, even if you're throwing away a Penny,you still got to value it.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: It's actually sentimental to see news outlets or blogs tagging ever scam done by individuals on cryptocurrency. Were some of these scams not/still done before involving fiat money. Was local banks actually not involved why was there no headlines stating them?Its no longer news to tell people to do DYOR but some people (mostly new investors) see cryptocurrency as quick get rich scheme and the greed leads them to falling for this schemes.I feel government should but more laws holding these celebrities accountable for every ponzi schemes they promote. But since it concerns cryptocurrency I don't see them doing anything but rather will be happy to have it on the bad side of the news.

comments.author: Mr.right85
comments.body: I won't pass any judgements on the influencers after all, it's there job and they are only doing there bit in the crypto space to project and at times, they too are the victims. We are familiar with the bounty board as a bard in which, we've got over 90% of projects undergoing promotions to be scams from history and still we've got a thousand more still being promoted.Sm times, these promoters are a victims too as much as those who invest in the project with hopes that it would turn out to be some gainful investment or something important I'm the crypto industry.Whats there to understand is that, you can never be too smart on your investments in the crypto industry. Some times you win and at other times you lose. Let the wins be a worthy compensation on the loses you would encounter on your journey and be good to accept which one comes.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Influencers are in fact never responsible for the risks and returns of your investment, so people will always advise you to take it as financial advice. An investor must be able to do good analysis before making decision so that they will not regret it in the future.Look at how many percentages of profits investors have received so far who are really able to analyze the market and bitcoin potential. They are actually not all know and clever, but their financial strength has sometimes brought them closer to big profits. I can't imagine how early adopters profited last year to be exact on November ATH, it was something that was completely beyond their expectations in bitcoin's early years.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Quote from: kamvreto on November 04, 2022, 07:19:11 PMInvesting in the crypto world is not easy, there will be many risks that will occur if you don't understand it.If you choose altcoins over Bitcoin.There's always a high risk when choosing which is the right investment in altcoins, the hype could be the number one goal of those altcoins owners to lure investors, and if you'll fall into their trap, you'll be their next victim.  It's easy to spot influencers on social media, you can unfollow them or put them into your black list users.Investing in Bitcoin alone which is proven in the market has been potential to make a profit but there's no specific time when you'll get it. It's trusted by most investors and some countries already making it a legal tender so I think, there's no single altcoin that can surpass Bitcoin's potential(aside from Ethereum).

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: Social media accounts of celebrities are targets for giveaway scams, there have been successful crypto heists in the past using accounts of famous individuals. It’s amazing how people blindly follow their idols. Many of these so called social media influencers do not know a thing about the products/service they get paid to advertise on their platforms, most of them didn’t become famous because of their intellectual ability and probably can’t hold a intelligent conversation behind the camera, You can’t hold them responsible when you lose your money to scam projects they advertise, that’s why I don’t give them the time of day.
